data.question: What are the two metal-organic framework materials synthesized using oligoparaxylene tetracarboxylate linkers?
What type of lattice layers do MFM-130 and MFM-131 contain?
What is the BET surface area of desolvated MFM-130, also known as MFM-130a?
Why does MFM-131 lose its crystallinity upon desolvation?
data.answer: MFM-131 shows almost complete loss of crystallinity after desolvation due to its inherent instability upon removal of solvates.

data.question: What is the volumetric CH4 adsorption capacity of MFM-130a at 35 bar and 298 K?
Is MFM-130a capable of selective adsorption of CO2 over N2?
What is the CO2/N2 adsorption selectivity of MFM-130a at 298 K?
Does MFM-130a show high selectivities for C2 hydrocarbons over CH4?
What is the isosteric heat of adsorption for H2 in MFM-130a at zero coverage?
Is the mechanical instability of MFM-131 upon desolvation due to its low shear modulus?
What is the main difference in the mechanical properties of MFM-130 and MFM-131?
data.answer: MFM-131 shows a lower average Young’s and shear moduli than MFM-130, explaining its instability upon desolvation.

data.question: What method was used for the quantum chemistry calculations of MFM-130 and MFM-131?
data.answer: Density functional theory approach with localized basis sets

data.question: Does MFM-130a have a higher CO2 adsorption enthalpy at low loading compared to MOF-505?
What is the selectivity for C2H6 vs CH4 in MFM-130a at 273 K?
Is the pore size of MFM-130 and MFM-131 significantly different?
What is the role of methyl substituents in MFM-130a's structure?
data.answer: The methyl substituents reduce the accessible pore volume, thus creating enhanced overlapping potential for CO2 molecules but lowering the adsorption of N2.

data.question: What is the crystal system of MFM-130?
Was synchrotron radiation used for data collection of MFM-131?
What is the largest free sphere diameter in MFM-130?
Does MFM-130a exhibit a higher H2 storage capacity at 77 K compared to NOTT-102?
